dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, B, Tesla, right? What a rollercoaster. We just saw this announcement of increased sales, but, um, the shares just absolutely plummeted.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While annual profit remains elusive, the results pushed its shares up as much as 11% on the heels of an eye-popping run that began in October.

dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, A, it's wild. Dropped, like, 11 percent, and it's all because of these eye-watering losses they've been seeing since October.

dialogue_turns.text: Right? I mean, a net loss of $105 million for the quarter. And that's on revenue of $7.38 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, adjusted EPS was below expectations too, you know? $2.14 versus the $1.72 analysts were hoping for.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, adjusted E P S was below expectations too, you know? two point one four dollars versus the one point seven two dollars analysts were hoping for.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adjusted EPS was $2.14. That topped expectations of $1.72 a share and revenue of $7.02 billion, according to a Reuters survey of equity analysts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and they got hit hard by losing those regulatory credits, right? The free money they used to get from other automakers?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and they got hit hard by losing those regulatory credits, right? The free money they used to get from other automakers?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla once again got a boost from sales of zero-emission and other regulatory credits to other automakers in the quarter, booking $133 million of the free money.

dialogue_turns.text: Totally. They only managed to book, like, $133 million of that this quarter, which is way down. And the shares, um, they crashed even more after hours.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They only managed to book, like, one hundred thirty three million dollars of that this quarter, which is way down. And the shares, um, they crashed even more after hours.

Theyve has more than doubled since a surprise third-quarter profit announcement on Oct. 23. Last year was a turning point for Tesla, Musk said in a letter to investors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] A disaster! He said they had weak demand for the Model 3, failed GAAP profitability, and a *huge* cash outflow. $1.1 billion!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Morgan Stanley's Adam Jonas even said it might be seen as a "bankrupt and cash-negative tech company." That's, uh, pretty stark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Morgan Stanley's Adam Jonas even said it might be seen as a bankrupt and cash-negative tech company. That's, uh, pretty stark.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This quarter may be seen as the moment a new genre of tech investors were waiting to perceive Tesla through a new narrative: as a profitable and cash generative tech company with a reasonably-sized market cap in the same discussion as the mega-tech platform names, Morgan Stanley equity analyst Adam Jonas said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And then you look at production. They're targeting fewer than 367,500 vehicles this year, down from 500,000.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you look at production. They're targeting fewer than three hundred sixty seven thousand, five hundred vehicles this year, down from five hundred thousand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla aims to deliver more than 500,000 vehicles this year, up from 367,500 in 2019, including more than 295,000 Model 3s, priced from about $40,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Model Y production was, like, canceled this month at Fremont, later than scheduled. And the Berlin plant? Abandoned for now, targeted for 2025.

Preparations for its third vehicle assembly plant, to be built near Berlin, are moving ahead and initial deliveries from it are targeted for as early as 2021.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And Edmunds' Jessica Caldwell points out the Model Y itself has, like, a less prestigious brand than hybrids, but costs way more than other luxury competition. Not a great spot.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So it sounds pretty grim, B. But, uh, amid all this, they *did* post an annual profit of $862 million on record revenue. A decade after their IPO!

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Teslas full-year loss was $862 million on record revenue of $26 billion. A decade after its initial public offering its never posted an annual profit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which is, you know, a silver lining amidst the, uh, gloom. And CFRA analyst Garrett Nelson still has a Buy rating, citing minimal risks for the China factory ramp-up.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amid the rosy numbers, CFRA equity analyst Garrett Nelson, who has a Sell rating on Tesla, thinks there are still reasons for caution. We continue to see significant risks related to the China factory ramp-up, as well as rising EV competition from automakers still eligible for the full federal tax credit in the U.S., Nelson said in a research note.

dialogue_turns.text: So there's still some optimism out there, despite all the, like, operational challenges and the stock plunge. What a complex picture, right?
